channel.title: Comments on: Would you be interested in an information section for SQLCop?
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: David Forck (thirster42)
item.dc:creator: David Forck (thirster42)
item.content:encoded:
My first thought is “Add All The Things!”

Mys econd thought is, add it so that you can tell SQL COP to only run the tests you want to run (I haven’t used it in a while do I don’t know if you’ve updated it).

item.title: By: Alex
item.dc:creator: Alex
item.description: I'm all for it. I may not use much of it (developer here) but I can see these being useful for the dba's.
item.content:encoded: I’m all for it. I may not use much of it (developer here) but I can see these being useful for the dba’s.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: I also have scripts for seeks vs scans ratio
item.content:encoded: I also have scripts for seeks vs scans ratio

item.title: By: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.dc:creator: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.description: Another good check would be indexes with no reads or very high write:read ratio. I'll have to take a look through my scrips folder later, it may make me think of some others.
item.content:encoded: Another good check would be indexes with no reads or very high write:read ratio. I’ll have to take a look through my scrips folder later, it may make me think of some others.
